Job Description:
Working for every patient in Europe
Working at EMA, you can make a difference in protecting the health of every individual and animal in Europe. Whatever your expertise, you will be part of a diverse and highly regarded team of over 800 talented colleagues. You will work at the heart of medicines development and regulation, while enjoying attractive benefits and a healthy work-life balance.
About this role
As a Scientific Communication Officer at EMA, you will be involved in writing safety announcements, public-friendly overviews for new medicines and other documents for patients, healthcare professionals and the general public. In preparing these documents, you will be interpreting complex scientific information and explaining it in plain English to help improve public understanding of the science underpinning EMA regulatory decisions.

You will also be involved in replying to queries about medicines from the general public and shaping messages to help communication experts across the EU network provide the public and the media with up-to-date information about medicines.

You will be part of team of medical writers working closely with press colleagues and with scientific and regulatory experts across the Agency.
The eligibility requirements
Enjoy full rights as a citizen of a European Union Member State or Iceland, Lichtenstein and Norway.
Possess a university degree in medicine, pharmacy or life-sciences (minimum of three years or more), that must have been obtained by the closing date of this vacancy notice.
Have at least 3 years’ relevant professional experience in writing or editing (e.g. as a medical writer) after obtaining the relevant degree and before the closing date of this vacancy notice.
Have a thorough knowledge of English (at least level C1) and a satisfactory knowledge of another official language of the European Union (at least level B2).
Have fulfilled any obligations imposed by applicable laws concerning military service - if applicable.


In addition, it also essential to have:
At least 3 years professional experience in a writing or editing role (e.g. as a medical writer) interpreting complex, scientific information and explaining it in plain English.
Professional experience writing for patients, healthcare professionals or the general public.
Writing and editing experience in the fields of medicines, science or public health.
Very good editorial, grammar and proof-reading skills.

How to apply?
If this sounds interesting to you, click on 'apply' to read more about the role, experience and skills required, employment conditions, and to submit your application.
Closing date for applications is 9 April 2021 at 23.59 CET
Areas of Research
Pharmacy
Communication & Media
Public Administration

The Accreditation and Member Services Manager conveys the value of AACSB accreditation and member services to business schools worldwide and assists schools with their continuous development and achievement of overall high quality. This role has a focus on schools in the Asia Pacific (AP) and Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) regions.
The position is best suited for candidates who enjoy recruiting and building successful member relationships and have strong analytical and writing skills most beneficial for accreditation related work. The ideal candidate will be interested in being part of a multi-cultural team and interacting with members from many different backgrounds.

Community Associate
AMSTERDAM, Amsterdamse Bos
At Regus, we’ve built the world’s largest workspace network so that our customers can work better, faster, happier. Join us in one of our Regus centre teams. Bring more freedom to more people and businesses. And you’ll be able to work better, faster and happier too.
The opportunity
As a Community Associate, you’ll work closely with new and existing customers, solving problems for them and making sure they have everything they need.
A typical day at Regus
You arrive 15 minutes before your centre opens to make sure everything is ready and check there’s nothing the cleaners have missed.
Customers start coming in thick and fast. One asks you for a changed WiFi code. Another wants to know if his important package has arrived. A woman needs directions to her meeting room… and can you help her set up the projector and take an order for drinks?
The mail arrives. You sort through it while dealing with a whole host of other customer requests, remembering to email the customer from earlier to let him know his package is waiting for him in his mailbox. And that’s lunch.
Early afternoon, you sit down with the Community Manager to discuss the organisation of next week’s networking event. You plan and write the invites to customers, then create, print and put up posters on the noticeboards around the centre.
The day is coming to a close. Time to gently ask the large group in meeting room 3 to start wrapping up. You direct them to the nice restaurant you know around the corner, so they can grab a bite and continue their discussion. Once the last person has left the building and everything’s nice and tidy, it’s time to head home.
About you
We’re looking for someone who knows how to manage multiple tasks while providing customers with the best possible service. You also need to be:
A good communicator, with the ability to build strong professional relationships and empathise with people’s needs
Happy taking ownership of problems and finding ways to solve them
Positive, enthusiastic and able to adapt to fast-changing situations
Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages
Fluent English & Dutch speaker
What we offer
On top of a competitive salary package you’ll enjoy:
A bright and inspiring work environment
Training and development opportunities

Community Associate
AMSTERDAM, Amsterdamse Bos
At Regus, we’ve built the world’s largest workspace network so that our customers can work better, faster, happier. Join us in one of our Regus centre teams. Bring more freedom to more people and businesses. And you’ll be able to work better, faster and happier too.
The opportunity
As a Community Associate, you’ll work closely with new and existing customers, solving problems for them and making sure they have everything they need.
A typical day at Regus
You arrive 15 minutes before your centre opens to make sure everything is ready and check there’s nothing the cleaners have missed.
Customers start coming in thick and fast. One asks you for a changed WiFi code. Another wants to know if his important package has arrived. A woman needs directions to her meeting room… and can you help her set up the projector and take an order for drinks?
The mail arrives. You sort through it while dealing with a whole host of other customer requests, remembering to email the customer from earlier to let him know his package is waiting for him in his mailbox. And that’s lunch.
Early afternoon, you sit down with the Community Manager to discuss the organisation of next week’s networking event. You plan and write the invites to customers, then create, print and put up posters on the noticeboards around the centre.
The day is coming to a close. Time to gently ask the large group in meeting room 3 to start wrapping up. You direct them to the nice restaurant you know around the corner, so they can grab a bite and continue their discussion. Once the last person has left the building and everything’s nice and tidy, it’s time to head home.

Positive, enthusiastic and able to adapt to fast-changing situations

Amsterdam, NL, 1017 BV
For our head office in Amsterdam on the Herengracht we are looking for a Client Administration Of-ficer. Are you able to perform a CDD analysis on a (new) client, have at least 2 years of experience in the field of CDD / KYC and do you want to contribute to the processing / optimization of the static data, then apply to this position!

Key Accountabilities
The Client administration department can be seen as the gateway to the bank. We are closely in-volved in many processes within the bank. We review new accounts / clients based on our client ac-ceptance policy. In addition, we are also responsible for the recording and analysis of all static data at account / relationship level. This involves on the one hand an investigative role; check whether a client's stated assets of origin are plausible. On the other hand; closely involved in the recording of data in the systems. Great precision is required here. The trick is to develop a helicopter view so that you can see the connections between the various data and activities.

The daily activities of the department are divided into blocks. Rotation take place every two weeks. The starting point is that everyone has mastered all these activities. Together with colleagues you are involved in the assessment of the files for the onboarding of clients. You schedule and prepare Client Acceptance meetings (CAC). In addition, the more operational activities are aimed at the correct recording of client data in our banking system, the responsibility for opening, closing and managing client files, progress monitoring, so proactively responding to urgent / important current matters within the department, proposing solutions and draw the attention of those involved. Finally, the checks for correctness and completeness of data, as well as process descriptions. You participate in current projects.


Knowledge / Experience / Competences

Knowledge/ Experience
Higher education or equivalent ability. Preferably experience in financial servicesKnowledge of current developments within the target group / customer group (legislation and regulations)Multi-year CDD / KYC experience.Knowledge of business structures, annual accounts and tax as-pects is an advantage.You understand the processes and systems used within a bank.Affinity with processing static data in banking systems.

Attributes/ Qualities
Being able to work independently and under time pressure.High integrity and accurate.Communicatively strong and decisive.You are proactive, collegial, have a hands-on mentality and are analytical.You want to contribute to the further development of the client onboarding process and the implementation of the CDD policy.

Language Skills (must have)
Fluent in Dutch and English

We offer you
A challenging, varied position where you come into contact with all disciplines of the bank. Lots of contact with committed and professional colleagues. InsingerGilissen attaches great importance to personal development. This means that you are given the space to take responsibility and develop entrepreneurship. Naturally, this includes a good salary and associated fringe benefits.

Language Skills (must have)
Fluent in Dutch and English

We offer you
A challenging, varied position where you come into contact with all disciplines of the bank. Lots of contact with committed and professional colleagues. InsingerGilissen attaches great importance to personal development. This means that you are given the space to take responsibility and develop entrepreneurship. Naturally, this includes a good salary and associated fringe benefits.

Amsterdam, NL, 1017 BV
For our head office in Amsterdam on the Herengracht we are looking for a Client Administration Of-ficer. Are you able to perform a CDD analysis on a (new) client, have at least 2 years of experience in the field of CDD / KYC and do you want to contribute to the processing / optimization of the static data, then apply to this position!

Key Accountabilities
The Client administration department can be seen as the gateway to the bank. We are closely in-volved in many processes within the bank. We review new accounts / clients based on our client ac-ceptance policy. In addition, we are also responsible for the recording and analysis of all static data at account / relationship level. This involves on the one hand an investigative role; check whether a client's stated assets of origin are plausible. On the other hand; closely involved in the recording of data in the systems. Great precision is required here. The trick is to develop a helicopter view so that you can see the connections between the various data and activities.

The daily activities of the department are divided into blocks. Rotation take place every two weeks. The starting point is that everyone has mastered all these activities. Together with colleagues you are involved in the assessment of the files for the onboarding of clients. You schedule and prepare Client Acceptance meetings (CAC). In addition, the more operational activities are aimed at the correct recording of client data in our banking system, the responsibility for opening, closing and managing client files, progress monitoring, so proactively responding to urgent / important current matters within the department, proposing solutions and draw the attention of those involved. Finally, the checks for correctness and completeness of data, as well as process descriptions. You participate in current projects.


Knowledge / Experience / Competences

Knowledge/ Experience
Higher education or equivalent ability. Preferably experience in financial servicesKnowledge of current developments within the target group / customer group (legislation and regulations)Multi-year CDD / KYC experience.Knowledge of business structures, annual accounts and tax as-pects is an advantage.You understand the processes and systems used within a bank.Affinity with processing static data in banking systems.

Attributes/ Qualities
Being able to work independently and under time pressure.High integrity and accurate.Communicatively strong and decisive.You are proactive, collegial, have a hands-on mentality and are analytical.You want to contribute to the further development of the client onboarding process and the implementation of the CDD policy.

Language Skills (must have)
Fluent in Dutch and English

We offer you
A challenging, varied position where you come into contact with all disciplines of the bank. Lots of contact with committed and professional colleagues. InsingerGilissen attaches great importance to personal development. This means that you are given the space to take responsibility and develop entrepreneurship. Naturally, this includes a good salary and associated fringe benefits.

Job Title: DIGITAL PROJECT LEADER - GROUP DIGITAL, INGKA GROUP
Job Description:
WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU


We are looking for several Digital Project Leaders (both Junior and Senior) to join our global team and growing Digital Hub in Amsterdam! This is your chance to join IKEA by leading projects that will transform us into the future of Digital.


We are looking for you with a true passion for Project management and with a desire to make connections across different disciplines. We believe you have deep knowledge within one of these particular areas of specialization:

a. Data and data Security
b. Finance
c. IT
d. Business Development


You also have a strong background and interest in business strategy and a successful track record of managing business change and transformation.

To succeed as Digital Project Leader, you preferable have a proven advanced training in Project Management or equivalent as well as:

2-5 years of experience in leading projects in a technical environment
knowledge and experience working with various technology platformsknowledge of project governance processes including risk management techniquesextensive ability to set goals, follow through, deliver and follow upexperience of using a data-driven approach to decision making, both in day-to-day management and in making strategic trade-offsexcellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage and communicate with senior business-leaders and Technology Leadership
It’s incredibly important to have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build trustful relationships and sound judgements with ability to make timely and effective decisions managing and leading teams and stakeholders.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES


You will be responsible for planning, driving, leading and delivering on assigned projects within Group Digital’s project office. You will be leading digital projects by driving consistency of ways of working and promoting best practices in project execution. This involves:


Driving and delivering assigned projects, including time, cost, scope and quality according to expectationsIdentifying, mitigating, monitoring and controlling risks to keep projects on track
Managing dependencies and interfaces between projects and line organisation to ensure common expectationsManaging procurement and vendor relations within projects, including follow up on performance and deliveries from vendor, to secure lowest cost of delivery and delivery according to expectationsPerforming project reporting, through providing Digital Project Office Team Manager with key milestones, updates and content for measuring and following up project quality and performanceDriving continuous improvement of quality and performance in assigned projects in agreement with the assigned Senior Project Leader for the projectIdentifying, planning and following up on stakeholders to ensure alignment and harmonised expectations
Working in compliance with all aspects of how we work with projects as planning, execution and quality assurance process, steering and follow up in order to promote best practices

ABOUT THIS WORK AREA


Our growing office in Amsterdam is located in the North-west of the city centre (Danzigerkade 14-15, Amsterdam). You will belong to a highly skilled team of both Junior and Senior Project Leaders located in both Southern Sweden and Amsterdam.

Group Digital set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fast-moving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through the use of new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace. At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.


QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to recruiter Sofia South at sofia.south@ingka.com. If you have questions about the role, please reach out to hiring manager Farzin Saber at farzin.saber@ingka.ikea.com


Please note


Our primary concern since the outbreak of corona virus has been the health and safety of our co-workers and candidates. Because of this, we have adapted our recruiting processes to be fully digital.

We would love to meet our candidates face to face, but to prevent the spread of the virus this recruitment will be handled through digital appointments and solutions.

2-5 years of experience in leading projects in a technical environment
knowledge and experience working with various technology platformsknowledge of project governance processes including risk management techniquesextensive ability to set goals, follow through, deliver and follow upexperience of using a data-driven approach to decision making, both in day-to-day management and in making strategic trade-offsexcellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage and communicate with senior business-leaders and Technology Leadership
It’s incredibly important to have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build trustful relationships and sound judgements with ability to make timely and effective decisions managing and leading teams and stakeholders.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES


You will be responsible for planning, driving, leading and delivering on assigned projects within Group Digital’s project office. You will be leading digital projects by driving consistency of ways of working and promoting best practices in project execution. This involves:


Driving and delivering assigned projects, including time, cost, scope and quality according to expectationsIdentifying, mitigating, monitoring and controlling risks to keep projects on track
Managing dependencies and interfaces between projects and line organisation to ensure common expectationsManaging procurement and vendor relations within projects, including follow up on performance and deliveries from vendor, to secure lowest cost of delivery and delivery according to expectationsPerforming project reporting, through providing Digital Project Office Team Manager with key milestones, updates and content for measuring and following up project quality and performanceDriving continuous improvement of quality and performance in assigned projects in agreement with the assigned Senior Project Leader for the projectIdentifying, planning and following up on stakeholders to ensure alignment and harmonised expectations
Working in compliance with all aspects of how we work with projects as planning, execution and quality assurance process, steering and follow up in order to promote best practices

ABOUT THIS WORK AREA


Our growing office in Amsterdam is located in the North-west of the city centre (Danzigerkade 14-15, Amsterdam). You will belong to a highly skilled team of both Junior and Senior Project Leaders located in both Southern Sweden and Amsterdam.

Group Digital set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fast-moving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through the use of new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace. At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.


QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to recruiter Sofia South at sofia.south@ingka.com. If you have questions about the role, please reach out to hiring manager Farzin Saber at farzin.saber@ingka.ikea.com


Please note


Our primary concern since the outbreak of corona virus has been the health and safety of our co-workers and candidates. Because of this, we have adapted our recruiting processes to be fully digital.

We would love to meet our candidates face to face, but to prevent the spread of the virus this recruitment will be handled through digital appointments and solutions.

At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when we are all ready to travel once more. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We’re tech-savvy travel lovers with a passion for helping people. We work together closely, no matter what language we speak or country we’re from, we’re there for each other as much as we are for our customers.

Become a member of our CS family.

Benefits (beyond your salary):

Lots of vacation days to go exploring.
Accommodation discount, so you can explore for less.
Bonus package to reward your hard work.
Full-time, paid training to help you on your way to success.
A huge learning and development platform tailored to you.
Being part of a thriving, open-minded work culture.
Work from our beautiful offices when they open again.

What you’ll be doing:

A lot of listening, responding and mediating between our international guests and partners to resolve issues.
Replying to emails and messages from customers all over the world in English and Norwegian.
Navigating different online IT tools and browsers to provide accurate information and follow set processes.
Supporting your teammates and colleagues with peer to peer learning and constructive feedback to encourage a positive working environment.
Regular involvement with company events, team meetings and projects.
Most importantly, always ensuring a high level of customer service.

What you need to do it:

Written and oral fluency in English and Norwegian.
A problem-solving and solution-driven mentality.
A positive, motivated mindset that’ll help you deal with some tricky customer problems.
An open mind to changing priorities and business processes.
Intermediate IT skills.
A desire to work in a team-based, fast-paced, international environment where you’ll embrace different cultures, nationalities and languages.

The company was founded in 1950 and is an ethical 4th generation family brokerage with over 80 staff and 85,000 plus clients. The head office is located in the UK.VacaturetekstMain Duties and Responsibilities: Answering the phone and dealing with customer queries and keeping a clear log of all calls and actions taken.Understanding the clients’ needs – listen, apply knowledge, offer clients guidance, help understanding and where applicable adviceEnsuring Balens Administration System records are accurate and up to date.Marketing research and contacting potential new clients in order to arrange appointments.To receive (potential) clients in the office.Ensuring clear communication with Balens in Malvern (UK).Supportive role towards the Director, manager and Senior Account Handler e.g. keeping a diary, letter/email writing, liaising with clients and other companies and other administrative support.Provide a good timely service to our clients, provide documentation and information to our clients.Ensure all administration and recording is prompt and accurate maintaining computer and manual records.Comply with the Financial Conduct Authority rules, regulations and principles.Be able to manage your own work flows and priorities.Key Job ElementsSpecific Skills required: Fluent language skills in Dutch & English (written and spoken)Good mathematical skillsKnowledge and Experience: Experience with Microsoft Office and Microsoft Outlook3 – 5 years’ experience in sales/customer service support within an International environmentInsurance experience (WFT Certificate or willing to follow the course)Personal Qualities:Ability to work as an individual with in a teamAbility to Locatie
Amsterdam
Industrie
Horeca
Type functie
Full Time
Salaris
2 200 - 2 200 € per Month
Publiceer
Recruiter
Tom Broekhuijse
Referentienummer
a0Y5J000000kQ1EUAU
Contract
Permanent

Vacature beschrijving
Top-notch food service for all people at home! In other words; that delicious meal was delivered right on time and by a super friendly courier. That's your job! You are in control to make the delivery service of our couriers as smooth and fast as possible.

A courier with a flat tire? An incomplete order? Nothing is too crazy for you! You switch quickly, solve a problem in no time and ensure happy customers. Our customers in 11 countries know where to find us when they feel like a Mexican burger, falafel, or Indian curry.

A day in the life of the Operations Coordinator:
Your day starts in the afternoon because the peak of delivery is of course in the evening. When you sit at your computer, you can already see the first orders coming in. While you're creating the order summary, a courier reports to you with a problem. He has a flat tire! It is of course extremely important that the Surinamese roti is still warm and therefore delivered exactly on time! You have the map of the city in front of you on your laptop, so you know exactly which other courier you can use now. Meanwhile, three other deliverers also report to you, each with a different problem. This is exactly what gives you energy; switch quickly, set priorities, solve problems, and above all… make our customers happy with top-notch service!

As a Live Operations Coordinator, you are part of the Customer Service team - and the following activities are the core tasks of your position:

You are the central figure in terms of operational support to all deliverers;
You help deliverers with all kinds of problems, with the aim of delivering all meals to the end customer exactly on time and with a smile;
You plan the rides of the deliverers and keep an overview of all deliverers in the city;
You maintain contact with the delivery staff (and sometimes with the restaurants) via chat, e-mail, and also by telephone.
All onboarding activities take place in the office. During the current situation, you work from home. If the measures surrounding corona become more flexible, you will increasingly work in the office.

Bedrijfsomschrijving
One of the biggest food delivery services in Europe.

Gestelde eisen
Your profile:

If you have experience in the hospitality industry, we would really like to meet you! Are you experienced in the field of customer service or logistics? That is also relevant work experience;
You get a lot of energy from helping customers. You are proactive, you can act quickly and you always keep a cool head;
You have strong communication skills, which means an excellent knowledge of the Dutch language and English language;
You have just or almost completed your education, you are taking a gap year or you have been working for a while - you are welcome with us;
You are full-time available, part-time is an option. You are flexible on evenings and weekends. We deliver meals from Monday to Sunday from 09:00 - 23:30 and we are mainly looking for coordinators for the evenings & weekends.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
As Operations Coordinator you benefit of the following employment conditions:

You are part of our booming business and you work in an international team with relatively young people;
You make an important contribution to our great customer service;
Crazy virtual events, such as online treasure hunting or playing karaoke. If life looks different again, we would like to see you in the canteen at the Playstation or for coffee;
Several privileges like delicious lunch delivered to your home, every month you will receive a voucher from us to use for yourself;
A salary of EUR 2.200,- gross monthly.
Bericht voor kandidaten
Triggered for applying? Please reach out to me via tom.broekhuijse@grafton.nl or call/WhatsApp me at +31 6 40 46 67 59.

You are full-time available, part-time is an option. You are flexible on evenings and weekends. We deliver meals from Monday to Sunday from 09:00 - 23:30 and we are mainly looking for coordinators for the evenings & weekends.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
As Operations Coordinator you benefit of the following employment conditions:

You are part of our booming business and you work in an international team with relatively young people;
You make an important contribution to our great customer service;
Crazy virtual events, such as online treasure hunting or playing karaoke. If life looks different again, we would like to see you in the canteen at the Playstation or for coffee;
Several privileges like delicious lunch delivered to your home, every month you will receive a voucher from us to use for yourself;
A salary of EUR 2.200,- gross monthly.
Bericht voor kandidaten
Triggered for applying? Please reach out to me via tom.broekhuijse@grafton.nl or call/WhatsApp me at +31 6 40 46 67 59.

Job Description:
Manager Operations Support
Do you have a real passion for leading a team of professionals? Are you hungry for a challenge, highly motivated, able to work in a fast pace environment, flexible and quick to adapt to any situation? As Manager Operations Support you will provide leadership and direction to a team of professional individual contributors. Together with your team you will ensure that the business runs smoothly and effectively and ensure service excellence to all internal and external customers.
You will oversee the daily operations, while keeping track of the big picture and identify potential areas of improvement. Coaching, leading and inspiring of your team will be your priority. You will also develop policies and procedures to make the business a better place, striving to create a high performance culture where waste and inefficiencies are things of the past. As a leader, fosters a work environment with a high level of integrity and strong (internal) customer focus that embraces diversity and inclusion, innovation, continuous improvement and empowerment.
Equinix is one of the fastest growing data center companies, growing connectivity between clients worldwide. That’s why we're always looking for creative and forward thinking people who can help us achieve our goal of global interconnection. With 200 data centers in over 24 countries spanning across 5 continents, we are home to the Cloud, supporting over 1000 Cloud and IT services companies that are directly engaged in technological innovation and development. We are passionate about further evolving the specific areas of software development, software and network architecture, network operations and complex cloud and application solutions.
At Equinix, we make the internet work faster, better, and more reliably. We hire talented people who thrive on solving hard problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, try new approaches, and grow in new directions. Our culture is at the heart of our success and it’s our authentic, humble, gritty people who create The Magic of Equinix. We share a real passion for winning and put the customer at the center of everything we do.
Responsibilities
Supervises, evaluates, and coordinates daily team operations and responsibilities to ensuring that (internal) customer issues and requests are appropriately logged, researched, and accurately resolved/completed in a timely manner, meeting and exceeding expectations.
Allocates, monitors, and assigns resources while delegating and monitoring workloads
Provide guidance and coaching to team members on day-to-day issues
Responsible for performance management, including reviews, goal setting and on-going feedback
Develops and monitors team goals; provides ongoing feedback and coaching; conducts performance reviews; leads by example; and ensures an atmosphere of open communication, teamwork and empowerment
Refine and implement the methods, procedures, tools and policies to ensure high-quality service is delivered to (internal) customers.
Builds and develops relevant business relationships, critically thinks about departmental problems, and takes action on resolving these issues.
Assist and supports the Head of Operations Support with (improvement) projects
Skills and Experiences
Leadership
At least 5 years’ experience in managing a team of professionals
People manager at heart; you will manage, coach, lead and inspire a group of professionals
Demonstrated professionalism and leadership skills along with ability to develop, direct, and support a team
Ability to effectively manage performance as well as set and achieve goals
Ability to build and enhance team productivity
Communication
Excellent English & Dutch verbal and written communication skills is a must
Outstanding interpersonal skills – ability to professionally communicate and interact with all levels of internal and external customers
Customer Service
Strong customer service and support focus with a desire to deliver a high quality service
Development
A desire to learn and improve skills and knowledge
Project Management
Ability to project manage, multitask and follow through
Strong organizational and planning skills
Personal Quality
Be flexible, show initiative and respond quickly when situations change
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Self-motivated and highly professional with ability to lead and take ownership and responsibility
Positive ‘can-do’ attitude
Team player

Editor - 80095
Gracenote - Netherlands Amsterdam, North Holland
POSITION: Editor, French Language
REPORTS TO: Team Lead
WORK LOCATION: Amsterdam (Netherlands)
Gracenote is an entertainment data and technology provider powering the world’s top music services, automakers, cable and satellite operators, and consumer electronics companies. At its core, Gracenote helps people find, discover and connect with the entertainment they love. Daily, Gracenote processes 35 billion rows of data and is quickly becoming a world-leader in return path “big data.” Over the past 3 years, the company has grown to more than 2000 employees in 17 countries, including over 600 of the world’s top engineers with a passion for music, video, sports, and entertainment technology. Founded in 1998, Gracenote is one of America’s most iconic and respected media companies.
We are currently looking for an Editor for the French language market.
ROLE: Our TV and movie Editor performs editorial functions related to the ongoing development and creation of media databases and content, specifically in the audiovisual sphere. The ideal candidate loves movies and series, is familiar and up to date with TV listings and the media sector in general. This person will be responsible for performing high-volume, complex manipulations on the entertainment information that forms the core of Gracenote’s media database, with special focus on creating and enhancing Top Content (Top Series, Top Movies, Keywords etc.).
RESPONSIBILITIES
Acquire and record correct information regarding programs and TV listings from a variety of French channels and top content providers.
Investigate, confirm and document questionable program content by consulting program information providers and others.
Consolidate data content and new program information in databases.
Edit and maintain TV listings information, create and curate information on movies and shows.
Maintain accurate database information and provide timely updating of listings information.
Ensure the accuracy of editorial content, authenticity of program information and timely delivery to in-house personnel.
Analyze, develop and recommend solutions to editorial, communication and technical procedural and operational needs.
Act as a customer service representative concerning product content and editorial policies.
Other duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS
Must be native or near-native French and have IMPECCABLE writing and verbal skills. The ability to commence asap is highly desirable.
Effective writing, grammatical, organizational, analytical, and communication skills.
Preferably with a background in journalism, copy writing or translation.
Good knowledge of French television and VOD programming preferred, and most importantly a love for movies.
We are looking for a quality focused individual with a high level of attention to detail.
Must be able to work accurately under deadline and willing to work outside regular business hours.
Windows proficiency and/or experience using other computer software and databases with excellent keyboarding skills.
Excellent Keyboarding skills expected.
Our passion for music, TV and sports is at the heart of everything we do. But what really makes us tick is our people. From Emeryville to Tokyo and Queensbury to Copenhagen, we are building the team that’s going to disrupt the digital universe. This starts by creating a workplace where all things entertainment are celebrated and innovation can come from anyone. If you are interested in being mission critical and on the leading edge of global entertainment technology then please contact us today!
Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
#LI-JR1
ABOUT NIELSEN
As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!
Job Type: Regular
Primary Location: Amsterdam,North Holland
Secondary Locations: , , ,
Travel: No

Editor - 80095
Gracenote - Netherlands Amsterdam, North Holland
POSITION: Editor, French Language
REPORTS TO: Team Lead
WORK LOCATION: Amsterdam (Netherlands)
Gracenote is an entertainment data and technology provider powering the world’s top music services, automakers, cable and satellite operators, and consumer electronics companies. At its core, Gracenote helps people find, discover and connect with the entertainment they love. Daily, Gracenote processes 35 billion rows of data and is quickly becoming a world-leader in return path “big data.” Over the past 3 years, the company has grown to more than 2000 employees in 17 countries, including over 600 of the world’s top engineers with a passion for music, video, sports, and entertainment technology. Founded in 1998, Gracenote is one of America’s most iconic and respected media companies.
We are currently looking for an Editor for the French language market.
ROLE: Our TV and movie Editor performs editorial functions related to the ongoing development and creation of media databases and content, specifically in the audiovisual sphere. The ideal candidate loves movies and series, is familiar and up to date with TV listings and the media sector in general. This person will be responsible for performing high-volume, complex manipulations on the entertainment information that forms the core of Gracenote’s media database, with special focus on creating and enhancing Top Content (Top Series, Top Movies, Keywords etc.).
RESPONSIBILITIES
Acquire and record correct information regarding programs and TV listings from a variety of French channels and top content providers.
Investigate, confirm and document questionable program content by consulting program information providers and others.
Consolidate data content and new program information in databases.
Edit and maintain TV listings information, create and curate information on movies and shows.
Maintain accurate database information and provide timely updating of listings information.
Ensure the accuracy of editorial content, authenticity of program information and timely delivery to in-house personnel.
Analyze, develop and recommend solutions to editorial, communication and technical procedural and operational needs.
Act as a customer service representative concerning product content and editorial policies.
Other duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS
Must be native or near-native French and have IMPECCABLE writing and verbal skills. The ability to commence asap is highly desirable.
Effective writing, grammatical, organizational, analytical, and communication skills.
Preferably with a background in journalism, copy writing or translation.
Good knowledge of French television and VOD programming preferred, and most importantly a love for movies.
We are looking for a quality focused individual with a high level of attention to detail.
Must be able to work accurately under deadline and willing to work outside regular business hours.
Windows proficiency and/or experience using other computer software and databases with excellent keyboarding skills.
Excellent Keyboarding skills expected.

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry.

JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT

The Supply Chain Services Representative is responsible to coordinate and execute administrative activities for a subset of suppliers/customers/flows, focusing on activities related to contract execution, planning and customer service. We seek a professional who will partner closely with our local customer service representatives, high seas teams, supply chain planners and transport and logistics team members.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Enter and complete all entries of commodity movements data in the system. Monitor and handle of all commodity contract application, review and follow up daily on the failed as well as the provisional applications.
Reconcile inventory with all plants and third party warehouses daily movements data and start/end stock confirmation, identify, escalate, investigate and resolve stock differences.
Declare monthly stocks to insurance in line with corporate and business group policy and procedures.
Settle all shipped and applied commodity contracts. Issue and dispatch of commodity sales invoices to customers, validate incoming purchase commodity invoices and the timely follow up on all exceptions raised by finance.
Review and validate incoming service invoices against relevant accruals/purchase order. Review and enter services accruals and monitors, analyze and report on expenses deviation with the local stakeholders.
Act as primary contact for supply chain management systems and tools used within their area. Bring together data and run regular reports in support of supply chain business processes.
Participate in local continuous improvement in contract execution process area and provide recommendations, ideas and plans to local and functional management. Provide data for local scorecard and related critical metrics for the local business and team.
Handle basic issues and problems under direct supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.
Dealing with administrative tasks related to invoicing -vendor management
Troubleshooting and handle costumer complains in a polite, determined manner

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Good communication skills.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office tools.
Relevant work experience in supply chain.
Experience handling customer complains
Financial background is highly an advantage
Fluent in English and in Dutch language skill
Attention to detail - precise accurate working stye
Stress resistent, resiliant personality
Experience working with SAP

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

International trade/shipping experience.

Our Offer

In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.

Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today.

Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill

Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more: https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/

Review and validate incoming service invoices against relevant accruals/purchase order. Review and enter services accruals and monitors, analyze and report on expenses deviation with the local stakeholders.
Act as primary contact for supply chain management systems and tools used within their area. Bring together data and run regular reports in support of supply chain business processes.
Participate in local continuous improvement in contract execution process area and provide recommendations, ideas and plans to local and functional management. Provide data for local scorecard and related critical metrics for the local business and team.
Handle basic issues and problems under direct supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.
Dealing with administrative tasks related to invoicing -vendor management
Troubleshooting and handle costumer complains in a polite, determined manner

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Good communication skills.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office tools.
Relevant work experience in supply chain.
Experience handling customer complains
Financial background is highly an advantage
Fluent in English and in Dutch language skill
Attention to detail - precise accurate working stye
Stress resistent, resiliant personality
Experience working with SAP

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

International trade/shipping experience.

Our Offer

In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.

Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today.

Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill

Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more: https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry.

JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT

The Supply Chain Services Representative is responsible to coordinate and execute administrative activities for a subset of suppliers/customers/flows, focusing on activities related to contract execution, planning and customer service. We seek a professional who will partner closely with our local customer service representatives, high seas teams, supply chain planners and transport and logistics team members.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Enter and complete all entries of commodity movements data in the system. Monitor and handle of all commodity contract application, review and follow up daily on the failed as well as the provisional applications.
Reconcile inventory with all plants and third party warehouses daily movements data and start/end stock confirmation, identify, escalate, investigate and resolve stock differences.
Declare monthly stocks to insurance in line with corporate and business group policy and procedures.
Settle all shipped and applied commodity contracts. Issue and dispatch of commodity sales invoices to customers, validate incoming purchase commodity invoices and the timely follow up on all exceptions raised by finance.
Review and validate incoming service invoices against relevant accruals/purchase order. Review and enter services accruals and monitors, analyze and report on expenses deviation with the local stakeholders.
Act as primary contact for supply chain management systems and tools used within their area. Bring together data and run regular reports in support of supply chain business processes.
Participate in local continuous improvement in contract execution process area and provide recommendations, ideas and plans to local and functional management. Provide data for local scorecard and related critical metrics for the local business and team.
Handle basic issues and problems under direct supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.
Dealing with administrative tasks related to invoicing -vendor management
Troubleshooting and handle costumer complains in a polite, determined manner

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Good communication skills.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office tools.
Relevant work experience in supply chain.
Experience handling customer complains
Financial background is highly an advantage
Fluent in English and in Dutch language skill
Attention to detail - precise accurate working stye
Stress resistent, resiliant personality
Experience working with SAP

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

International trade/shipping experience.

Our Offer

In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.

Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today.

Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill

Join a diverse team that is driving growth and adoption of Cisco Collaboration solutions into the market, being responsible for the move to cloud and as a service models and reinventing traditional competing vendors in the space. 2020 confirmed that solutions for safe secure remote workforce and a trusted work place is very relevant in today’s market. The future of the companies' success is based on being able to provide these two attributes quickly, efficiently and cost effetely. Become part of the multifaceted Product Sales Specialist (PSS) team that owns and drives the product and solution strategy for Cisco Collaboration. Take control of the business, make an impact, and craft the market by engaging with our customers and encouraging the Cisco general sales teams. You will own and deliver on sales targets for the Cisco Cloud Collaboration business in Netherlands. Forecast, supervise and analyze the bookings/pipeline in your territory Responsible for developing and implementing the go-to-market plans to accelerate the growth into the Dutch market. Provide subject matter expertise for and work closely with the sales organization/channels teams Ensure Cisco Collaboration go-to-market readiness in sales, channel and customer advocacy organizations Work with Cisco Collaboration Marketing and Commercial teams to drive campaigns and programs to generate incremental bookings and pipeline Drive training and awareness initiatives for customers, partners and distribution. Who You’ll Work With
In an industry where success is measured in a tenth of a second, Cisco are the fuel for innovation. Innovation is the heart of collaboration. By connecting great minds with powerful solutions, Cisco’s Collaboration solutions empower the ideas that will define tomorrow's marketplace. Additionally it enables our customers to work in a whole new way. With mobility and cloud, devices and locations no longer matter, and the quality of the Cisco Collaboration experience helps people to achieve outstanding things. Delivering simple, magnificent and open teamwork experience is more meaningful to businesses than ever before and Cisco's Collaboration solution portfolio exactly aligns technology to meet our customer's key business priorities. Who You Are Passionate about helping companies make a difference by changing the way they work through powerful collaboration experiences
Understand and can articulate how excellent end user experiences drive usage and utilisation of collaboration solutions Experience in a selling or consulting role for Collaboration or software, cloud and mobility offerings Strong understanding of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) and Cloud Strong communication, presentation and written skills A history of meeting or exceeding business objectives and revenue targets Strong business network and knowledge of the Belgium & Luxembourg market including customers and partners, especially in the Commercial segment. Suitable technology or business university degree qualification preferred Why Cisco
We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to craft the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with outstanding personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.
We are leaders with vision, tech enthusiasts, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.
Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Social media trends enthusiast? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco
Cisco is an equal opportunity employer.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Social media trends enthusiast? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco
Cisco is an equal opportunity employer.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Join a diverse team that is driving growth and adoption of Cisco Collaboration solutions into the market, being responsible for the move to cloud and as a service models and reinventing traditional competing vendors in the space. 2020 confirmed that solutions for safe secure remote workforce and a trusted work place is very relevant in today’s market. The future of the companies' success is based on being able to provide these two attributes quickly, efficiently and cost effetely. Become part of the multifaceted Product Sales Specialist (PSS) team that owns and drives the product and solution strategy for Cisco Collaboration. Take control of the business, make an impact, and craft the market by engaging with our customers and encouraging the Cisco general sales teams. You will own and deliver on sales targets for the Cisco Cloud Collaboration business in Netherlands. Forecast, supervise and analyze the bookings/pipeline in your territory Responsible for developing and implementing the go-to-market plans to accelerate the growth into the Dutch market. Provide subject matter expertise for and work closely with the sales organization/channels teams Ensure Cisco Collaboration go-to-market readiness in sales, channel and customer advocacy organizations Work with Cisco Collaboration Marketing and Commercial teams to drive campaigns and programs to generate incremental bookings and pipeline Drive training and awareness initiatives for customers, partners and distribution. Who You’ll Work With
In an industry where success is measured in a tenth of a second, Cisco are the fuel for innovation. Innovation is the heart of collaboration. By connecting great minds with powerful solutions, Cisco’s Collaboration solutions empower the ideas that will define tomorrow's marketplace. Additionally it enables our customers to work in a whole new way. With mobility and cloud, devices and locations no longer matter, and the quality of the Cisco Collaboration experience helps people to achieve outstanding things. Delivering simple, magnificent and open teamwork experience is more meaningful to businesses than ever before and Cisco's Collaboration solution portfolio exactly aligns technology to meet our customer's key business priorities. Who You Are Passionate about helping companies make a difference by changing the way they work through powerful collaboration experiences
Understand and can articulate how excellent end user experiences drive usage and utilisation of collaboration solutions Experience in a selling or consulting role for Collaboration or software, cloud and mobility offerings Strong understanding of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) and Cloud Strong communication, presentation and written skills A history of meeting or exceeding business objectives and revenue targets Strong business network and knowledge of the Belgium & Luxembourg market including customers and partners, especially in the Commercial segment. Suitable technology or business university degree qualification preferred Why Cisco
We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to craft the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with outstanding personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.
We are leaders with vision, tech enthusiasts, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.
Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Social media trends enthusiast? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco
Cisco is an equal opportunity employer.

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We design, manufacture, install, and service wind turbines across the globe, and with more than 113 GW of wind turbines in 81 countries, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. Through our industry-leading smart data capabilities and unparalleled more than 96 GW of wind turbines under service, we use data to interpret, forecast, and exploit wind resources and deliver best-in-class wind power solutions.Together with our customers, Vestas’ more than 25.000 employees are bringing the world sustainable energy solutions to power a bright future. Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills and perspectives, and gives everyone equal access to opportunity. We invite you to learn more about Vestas by visiting our website at www.vestas.com and following us on our social media channels.The Vestas Offshore Service department is responsible for service and maintenance of the wind turbines in multiple windfarms in the North Sea within the Netherlands. The department has an open and informal culture, where teamwork and good communication is the key to our success. You will have the opportunity to work in an exciting industry and in a team of highly motivated employees.The Offshore Service Technicians are working in a teams of 2 -3 on Offshore Wind Farms in the Netherlands, managed daily by the site Supervisor. The task includes routine checks, maintenance of the electrical and mechanical systems, and significant component replacement on our offshore wind turbines.ResponsibilitiesExecute maintenance of electrical and mechanical systems as directed by Supervisor.Maintaining and upgrading installation activitiesCarrying out a diversity of check-ups, repairs and replacement activities of turbine componentsResponsible for a frictionless operation of our turbines and use of our systems like Condition Monitoring / Remote ControlCreating follow-up ordersRegistration of time and material consumptionCompliance to MHI Vestas's and client's procedures, processes, policies including Health and Safety instructionsQualificationsCompleted electrical or mechanical degree from a technical school/college/universityFluent English knowledge, Dutch is an advantageIdeally 2 years of experience in electrical and mechanical fieldGood knowledge of MS OfficeDriving license category BCompetenciesComfortable with working at heights and offshoreHigh level of safety awarenessReliable and team player attitudeExcellent problem solving skillsWhat we offerWe offer a challenging job, an excellent learning environment and opportunities for career development at the world's leading wind turbine manufacturer. You will become part of a highly professional culturally diverse team in a constantly growing industry. We provide a competitive compensation package and a 40 hours/week working contract without rotation work.Additional informationLiving in the area of Ijmuiden (maximum 50 km away) or willing to relocate.Please apply with your English CV online on our career portalJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

Location:
Brazil


We are now looking for a new Service & Installation Engineer to join our team in Brazil.

As a Service & Installation Engineer you will travel from customer to customer mainly to install new equipment and production lines. In this proces you are responsible for the mechanical start up and fine tuning of these new installations. In some cases you need to overhaul mechanically and electrically equipment and production lines, including the start up after the overhaul. During these activities you give basicinstructions to local operators and maintenance staff.


Key responsibilities:
Execution of the Service &Installation activities including start-up and commissioning at our customer site.
Showing team effort in working together with other Field Engineers and also with local operators, maintenance &quality staff from our customers.
Working at all time according Safety and Hygienic policy of Meyn and his customers.
Being responsible of using and keeping the tools provided proper and safe.
Lifting and tilting of equipment and constructions only with a permit to doso and under safe conditions

Degree:

Education in Mechanical/Electrical technical course or equal
working experience
Understanding of Basic Safety
License for driving a car.

List years of experience:

Minimal 2 years of Field Engineer experience.

Specific skill set:

Control of Electric and Argon welding is a plus.
Ability to read technical diagrams and schematics.
Independence and willingness to travel over a 4-week periods.
Flexible service mentality.
Good Communication skills and showing responsibility.
Result mindedness and ability to constructively communicate and report.
Good command of English and the local language in word and writing is
desired.

At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when we are all ready to travel once more. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We’re tech-savvy travel lovers with a passion for helping people. We work together closely, no matter what language we speak or country we’re from, we’re there for each other as much as we are for our customers.

Become a member of our CS family.

Benefits (beyond your salary):

Lots of vacation days to go exploring.
Accommodation discount, so you can explore for less.
Bonus package to reward your hard work.
Full-time, paid training to help you on your way to success.
A huge learning and development platform tailored to you.
Being part of a thriving, open-minded work culture.
Work from our beautiful offices when they open again.

What you’ll be doing:

A lot of listening, responding and mediating between our international guests and partners to resolve issues.
Replying to emails and messages from customers all over the world in English and Icelandic.
Navigating different online IT tools and browsers to provide accurate information and follow set processes.
Supporting your teammates and colleagues with peer to peer learning and constructive feedback to encourage a positive working environment.
Regular involvement with company events, team meetings and projects.
Most importantly, always ensuring a high level of customer service.

What you need to do it:

Written and oral fluency in English and Icelandic.
A problem-solving and solution-driven mentality.
A positive, motivated mindset that’ll help you deal with some tricky customer problems.
An open mind to changing priorities and business processes.
Intermediate IT skills.
A desire to work in a team-based, fast-paced, international environment where you’ll embrace different cultures, nationalities and languages.

At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when we are all ready to travel once more. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We’re tech-savvy travel lovers with a passion for helping people. We work together closely, no matter what language we speak or country we’re from, we’re there for each other as much as we are for our customers.

Become a member of our CS family.

Benefits (beyond your salary):

Lots of vacation days to go exploring.
Accommodation discount, so you can explore for less.
Bonus package to reward your hard work.
Full-time, paid training to help you on your way to success.
A huge learning and development platform tailored to you.
Being part of a thriving, open-minded work culture.
Work from our beautiful offices when they open again.

What you’ll be doing:

A lot of listening, responding and mediating between our international guests and partners to resolve issues.
Replying to emails and messages from customers all over the world in English and Icelandic.
Navigating different online IT tools and browsers to provide accurate information and follow set processes.
Supporting your teammates and colleagues with peer to peer learning and constructive feedback to encourage a positive working environment.
Regular involvement with company events, team meetings and projects.
Most importantly, always ensuring a high level of customer service.

What you need to do it:

Written and oral fluency in English and Icelandic.
A problem-solving and solution-driven mentality.
A positive, motivated mindset that’ll help you deal with some tricky customer problems.
An open mind to changing priorities and business processes.
Intermediate IT skills.
A desire to work in a team-based, fast-paced, international environment where you’ll embrace different cultures, nationalities and languages.

At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when we are all ready to travel once more. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We’re tech-savvy travel lovers with a passion for helping people. We work together closely, no matter what language we speak or country we’re from, we’re there for each other as much as we are for our customers.

JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT

The Customer Service Lead Europe leads and provides direction to supervisors, coordinators and indirect staff, leading all aspects of day-to-day customer service activities. We seek an experienced professional to lead, advise and make decisions on all major customer service activities for our European region.

Position is part of the Supply Chain Leadership team.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Oversee supervisors in the selection of staff and other employees, resolving resources needs and approve candidates

Oversee and direct on deciding which tools/systems are appropriate to use for specific customer service environments

Leads communication with customers regarding order status, sales forecast, invoices, contract balances and other pertinent information needed to complete the sale

Develop and implement customer service strategies for a medium-to-large customer base

Direct and contribute to definition of improvement projects and commitments requiring an extensive understanding of customer service practices and procedures

Develop plans and deliver results in a fast-changing business or regulatory environment, while leading and developing a team of experienced professionals and supervisors, coaching and making decisions related to talent management hiring, performance and disciplinary actions. You will also collaborate with managers and supervisors in your organization to ensure staff selections align with current and future needs

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience

Minimum of six years of related work experience

Other minimum qualifications may apply

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

3-5 years of managerial experience, preferably in Customer Service

Proven ability to lead a regional and diverse organization

SAP knowledge
Demonstrated strong communications skills with the ability to positively influence stakeholders throughout the organization
Effectiveness in coaching, motivating and developing high performing individuals and teams

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience

Minimum of six years of related work experience

Other minimum qualifications may apply

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

3-5 years of managerial experience, preferably in Customer Service

Proven ability to lead a regional and diverse organization

SAP knowledge
Demonstrated strong communications skills with the ability to positively influence stakeholders throughout the organization
Effectiveness in coaching, motivating and developing high performing individuals and teams

JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT

The Customer Service Lead Europe leads and provides direction to supervisors, coordinators and indirect staff, leading all aspects of day-to-day customer service activities. We seek an experienced professional to lead, advise and make decisions on all major customer service activities for our European region.

Position is part of the Supply Chain Leadership team.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Oversee supervisors in the selection of staff and other employees, resolving resources needs and approve candidates

Oversee and direct on deciding which tools/systems are appropriate to use for specific customer service environments

Leads communication with customers regarding order status, sales forecast, invoices, contract balances and other pertinent information needed to complete the sale

Develop and implement customer service strategies for a medium-to-large customer base

Direct and contribute to definition of improvement projects and commitments requiring an extensive understanding of customer service practices and procedures

Develop plans and deliver results in a fast-changing business or regulatory environment, while leading and developing a team of experienced professionals and supervisors, coaching and making decisions related to talent management hiring, performance and disciplinary actions. You will also collaborate with managers and supervisors in your organization to ensure staff selections align with current and future needs

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience

Minimum of six years of related work experience

Other minimum qualifications may apply

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

3-5 years of managerial experience, preferably in Customer Service

Proven ability to lead a regional and diverse organization

SAP knowledge
Demonstrated strong communications skills with the ability to positively influence stakeholders throughout the organization
Effectiveness in coaching, motivating and developing high performing individuals and teams
